section.p: This document provides an overview of the new features contained within HPE Helion OpenStack 2.1.5.

section.title: Issues Fixed in this Release
section.p: This release includes the following fixes:

p.b: HPE Linux compute node crashes due to kernel panic

section.p: Beginning with linux kernel version 3.14.57, random periodic kernel panics and reboots may occur. This kernel upgrade fixes the issue with a new kernel.

ol.li: The ASN.1 implementation in OpenSSL before 1.0.1o and 1.0.2 before 1.0.2c allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code or cause a denial of service.

The AES-NI implementation in OpenSSL before 1.0.1t and 1.0.2 before 1.0.2h does not consider memory allocation during a certain padding check, which allows remote attackers to obtain sensitive cleartext information.

p.b: Emulex be2net driver: unsuccessful NIC failover fixed

section.p: Addresses a failover issue with the Emulex NIC driver in HPE Linux. When the primary network uplink is removed from the switch, the disconnect carrier signal is not sent to the Emulex driver telling it to switch over to the secondary path.
A security issue affecting Red Hat Linux has been fixed.
Link status messages in kernel log with backported be2net 10.2u driver

section.title: Upgrading or Installing
section.p: To download HPE Helion OpenStack 2.1.5, log into HDN and find the location of Helion OpenStack 2.1.5. The file you download will be called HelionOpenStack-2.1.5.tgz. The ISO will be named _______________.
To upgrade, follow the instructions in Upgrading to HPE Helion OpenStack 2.1.5
To perform a full install of HPE Helion OpenStack 2.1.5, follow the instructions for your specific configuration needs in the installation section.
